results.title: Majorettes in space (E)
results.creator_credit: Haut et Court, Fidelite Productions, Little Bear, CDP, Simon Arnal-Szlovak, Carole Scotta, Stephanie Boussion, Olivier Delbosc, Marc Missonnier, Catherine Dussar, David Fourier, Francois Ozon, Pierre Salvadori and Bruno Rolland
results.brief_description: A collection of five gay shorts from France which inventively explore a myriad of themes from sexual diversity, notions of family, and the erotic correlation between sex and death. “Majorettes in space” (Dir: David Fourier) - using a rapid mixture of word association and seemingly unconnected images, “Majorettes in space” thematically links topics as unlikely as the Pope, cheerleaders, safe sex and space exploration (1996); “A little death” (Dir: Francois Ozon) - a gay man comes to terms with his own mortality when he learns that his estranged father is dying (1995); “One moment” (Dir: Pierre Salvadori) - through clever use of point of view and hand held camera we experience first hand a highly charged one night stand between two men which leads to a careless split second decision (1996); “Something different” (Dir: Bruno Rolland) - a low key comedy about the unlikely relationship that develops between a transvestite butcher and a little boy (1994); “A summer dress” (Dir: Francois Ozon) - a young gay man on summer holiday with his lover has an unexpected encounter with a woman while sunbathing nude on the beach (1997).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Haut et Court, Fidelite Productions, Little Bear, CDP, Simon Arnal-Szlovak, Carole Scotta, Stephanie Boussion, Olivier Delbosc, Marc Missonnier, Catherine Dussar, David Fourier, Francois Ozon, Pierre Salvadori and Bruno Rolland

results.title: Major league (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Chris Chesser, Irby Smith and David S. Ward
results.brief_description: The recently widowed, and new owner of the Cleveland Indians has a plan: field the worst team ever, watch the attendance fall, then move the franchise to glorious sun-drenched Miami. So she signs a punk-pitcher (Charlie Sheen), a gimpy-kneed womanising catcher (Tom Berenger), a third-rate third baseman (Corbin Bernsen), the outfielder Willie May Hates (Wesley Snipes) and a ‘wayout’ field of other crazy misfits. The perfect plan? maybe not, but it is the perfect ingredients for this riotous and inspiring comedy.

results.title: Maitre
results.creator_credit: Paris Cite Productions, Weston Woods Studios, Manuel Otero and Jacques Leroux
results.brief_description: This animated film is an abstract expression of the dilemma of the artist in his search for recognition. The source and process of artistic inspiration are explored as well as the artist’s reactions to his own failure and success. No commentary, music only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paris Cite Productions, Weston Woods Studios, Manuel Otero and Jacques Leroux

results.title: Maisy: colours and counting
results.brief_description: Ten short animated stories about Maisy - a charming young female mouse and her friends, including Charley the crocodile, Eddie the elephant, and Cyril the squirrel. Each story has voiceover narration and a gently comic tone that teaches children about colours and counting. “Shed”: Eddie helps Maisy paint the shed green, blue, yellow and red. “Hide and seek”: Maisy, Tallulah and Charlie have fun playing hide and seek. “Spots”: Maisy runs into a leopard while she is outside and together they look at all the spotted things outside. “Circus”: Maisy’s circus is in town and everyone’s performing. “Eggs”: Maisy and friends have an Easter egg hunt. Maisy and Charlie have just as much fun hiding them as the others do finding and eating them. “Bus”: Maisy’s driving the school bus and follows the numbered stops to pick up her friends. “Train”: Driving the train, Maisy picks up animal passengers, number by number, from 1 to 10. “Harvest”: Maisy goes vegetable picking. “Stick”: Maisy finds lots of uses for her walking stick. Tallulah has some ideas too. “Clouds”: Maisy enjoys a picnic in a hot air balloon. Vocal and sounds by the Umbilical Brothers. Narrated by Neil Morrisey. Created by Lucy Cousins.

results.title: Maisy: birthday and other stories
results.brief_description: Ten short animated stories about Maisy - a charming young female mouse and her friends, including Charley the crocodile, Eddie the elephant, and Cyril the squirrel. Each story has voiceover narration and a gently comic tone that endorses the virtues of friendship and sharing. “Birthday” - Maisy invites her friends over for a birthday celebration. “Party” - Maisy is attending a fancy dress party and struggles to find an original outfit. “Playhouse” - Maisy hosts a tea party for her toys and Charley comes over to join in. “Treasure” - Charlie visits Maisy, who is dressed as a pirate, and the two of them proceed to dig for buried treasure, finding join coins with which to buy ice-cream. “Lemonade” - on a hot day Maisy decides to make fresh lemonade for herself and Eddie. “Parade” - with musical instruments in tow, Maisy and her friends stage a parade. “Balloons” - Maisy and Cyril buy balloons at the park, then have to figure out how to prevent them flying away whilst they play. “Fair” - the fair comes to town and Maisy and her friends go on many exciting rides. “Playground” - Maisy and her friends go to the park and play on the slide, seesaw and swing. “Tummy ache” - After playing with Maisy, Charlie eats too many cupcakes then proceeds to feel quite ill. Maisy works at making him feel better. Created by Lucy Cousins.

results.title: Maisy and panda
results.brief_description: Ten short animated stories about Maisy - a charming young female mouse and her friends, including Charley the crocodile, Eddie the elephant, and Cyril the squirrel. Each story has voiceover narration and a gently comic tone that endorses the virtues of friendship and sharing. “Panda”: Daisy takes Panda to the playground where they run into Cyril and his bouncing ball. “Torch”: Tallulah brings over her new torch and everyone has fun making shadow puppets. “Library”: Charlie and Maisy take a trip to the library to return some books. “Wheel”: Pushhorse has lost a wheel and Panda is in for a wobbly ride unless they can locate the missing wheel. “Puppets”: Cyril makes a visit and Maisy and her friends enjoy the puppet show he puts on. “Cleaning”: A hungry Charlie is getting in the way of Maisy’s cleaning. “Doctor”: Maisy’s playing dress ups and today she’s Doctor Maisy. First patient is an unwell Panda. Tallulah plays nurse. “Wheelbarrow”: Using her wheelbarrow and shovel, Maisy plants a new tree in the garden, Rabbit’s proving a hindrance. “Snail”: Charlie makes friends with a snail he discovers on the watering can. “Goodnight”: Tallulah sleeps over and she and Maisy make the necessary bedtime preparations. Vocal and sounds by the Umbilical Brothers. Narrated by Neil Morrisey. Created by Lucy Cousins.

results.title: Maisy's farm
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, King Rollo Films, Clive Juster and Leo Nielsen
results.brief_description: Discover all the work that has to be done around the farm for each of the year’s four seasons as Maisy and her friends, Tallulah, Charley, Cyril and Eddie, have fun while they work. Other adventures see them climbing a mountain, going on a train journey, shopping, finding out about bugs, a duckling and even about breakfast! DVD contains sixteen sing-a-long songs that toddlers will just love and also five interactive games. Simple animation with bold, primary colours makes Maisy very appealing to the 0 to 4 year age group. Sounds and voices provided by Australia’s Umbilical Brothers. Based on books by Lucy Cousins, narrated by Neil Morrissey. Comes with Instruction booklet.

results.title: Mais ou et donc ornicar
results.creator_credit: Mallia Films and Bertrand van Effenterre
results.brief_description: Two women decide to alter the course of their lives by seeking new paths away from the roles traditionally ascribed to them by society. One, Isabelle (Geraldine Chaplin), begins directing a video production unit for sociological research into the life experiences and opinions of a broad array of women; the other, Anne (Brigitte Fossey), becomes a successful garage mechanic and foreman despite the challenges of being taken seriously by customers and co-workers. Both women face challenges inherent within their chosen fields, but also encounter difficulties achieving a work and family life balance, becoming acutely aware of the needs of their children/lovers/ husbands. These scenarios act as a means for director Bertrand van Effenterre to examine the complexities inherent within communication between the sexes and the tribulations of relationships for women, but also for men facing female emancipation. The narrative, brimming with intriguing and humorous insights into the plights faced by women struggling to discover ways in which they might find their identity and even happiness, is bolstered by strong key performances. Also stars: Jean-Francois Stevenin, Didier Flamand, Jean-Jacques Biraud and Claire Denis.

results.title: Maintenance and sharpening of power saw chains
results.brief_description: Unsatisfactory performance and service of power saw chains is usually due to inadequate maintenance. Shows three basic rules for maintenance: check chain tension; check oiling system and use only correct oil; regularly “touch up” chain cutting teeth with file without removing from saw.
